project.name: Bluetooth
project.summary: Project for recording bluetooth metrics.

event.name: BluetoothAdapterStateChanged
event.summary: Records the toggle of the adapter.

metric.name: BootId
metric.summary: Random ID generated at boot time to detect reboots.

metric.name: SystemTime
metric.summary: The time elapsed since boot, in microseconds.

metric.name: IsFloss
metric.summary: Boolean indicating if the Bluetooth is using Floss.

metric.name: AdapterState
metric.summary: The state of the bluetooth adapter, 0 for disabled and 1 for enabled.

event.name: BluetoothPairingStateChanged
event.summary: Records the device pairing state change.

metric.name: BootId
metric.summary: Random ID generated at boot time to detect reboots.

metric.name: SystemTime
metric.summary: The time elapsed since boot, in microseconds.

metric.name: DeviceId
metric.summary: The bluetooth device id.

metric.name: DeviceType
metric.summary: The bluetooth device type such as LE, BREDR.

metric.name: PairingState
metric.summary: The state of the pairing.

event.name: BluetoothAclConnectionStateChanged
event.summary: Records the ACL connection state change.

metric.name: BootId
metric.summary: Random ID generated at boot time to detect reboots.

metric.name: SystemTime
metric.summary: The time elapsed since boot, in microseconds.

metric.name: IsFloss
metric.summary: Boolean indicating if the Bluetooth is using Floss.

metric.name: DeviceId
metric.summary: The bluetooth device id.

metric.name: DeviceType
metric.summary: The bluetooth device type such as LE, BREDR.

metric.name: ConnectionDirection
metric.summary: Whether it is an incoming or outgoing connection.

metric.name: ConnectionInitiator
metric.summary: Whether the connection is established by clients or system.

metric.name: StateChangeType
metric.summary: Whether it is a connection or disconnection state change.

metric.name: AclConnectionState
metric.summary: The state of the connection.

event.name: BluetoothProfileConnectionStateChanged
event.summary: Records the profile connection state change.

metric.name: BootId
metric.summary: Random ID generated at boot time to detect reboots.

metric.name: SystemTime
metric.summary: The time elapsed since boot, in microseconds.

metric.name: DeviceId
metric.summary: The bluetooth device id.

metric.name: StateChangeType
metric.summary: Whether it is a connection or disconnection state change.

metric.name: Profile
metric.summary: The bluetooth profile.

metric.name: ProfileConnectionState
metric.summary: The state of the profile connection.

event.name: BluetoothSuspendIdStateChanged
event.summary: Records the state of suspend id at resume.

metric.name: BootId
metric.summary: Random ID generated at boot time to detect reboots.

metric.name: SystemTime
metric.summary: The time elapsed since boot, in microseconds.

metric.name: SuspendIdState
metric.summary: The state of the suspend id at resume, 0 for not recorded and 1 for recorded.

event.name: BluetoothDeviceInfoReport
event.summary: Records the bluetooth device info.

metric.name: BootId
metric.summary: Random ID generated at boot time to detect reboots.

metric.name: SystemTime
metric.summary: The time elapsed since boot, in microseconds.

metric.name: DeviceId
metric.summary: The bluetooth device id.

metric.name: DeviceType
metric.summary: The bluetooth device type such as LE, BREDR.

metric.name: DeviceClass
metric.summary: The major class of the BR/EDR device.

metric.name: DeviceCategory
metric.summary: The category of the BLE device.

metric.name: VendorId
metric.summary: The vendor id of the bluetooth device.

metric.name: VendorIdSource
metric.summary: The vendor id source such as SIG and USB.

metric.name: ProductId
metric.summary: The product id of the bluetooth device.

metric.name: ProductVersion
metric.summary: The product version of the bluetooth device.

event.name: BluetoothAudioQualityReport
event.summary: Records the quality of audio connection.

metric.name: BootId
metric.summary: Random ID generated at boot time to detect reboots.

metric.name: SystemTime
metric.summary: The time elapsed since boot, in microseconds.

metric.name: DeviceId
metric.summary: The bluetooth device id.

metric.name: Profile
metric.summary: The bluetooth profile.

metric.name: QualityType
metric.summary: The type of measured indicator, e.g. RSSI, NAK_Count, No_Rx_Count.

metric.name: Average
metric.summary: The average value of the parameter.

metric.name: StdDev
metric.summary: The standard deviation value of the parameter.

metric.name: Percentile95
metric.summary: The 95th percentile value of the parameter.

event.name: BluetoothChipsetInfoReport
event.summary: Records the bluetooth chipset info.

metric.name: BootId
metric.summary: Random ID generated at boot time to detect reboots.

metric.name: VendorId
metric.summary: The vendor id of the bluetooth controller.

metric.name: ProductId
metric.summary: The product id of the bluetooth controller.

metric.name: Transport
metric.summary: Which transport the bluetooth controller uses.

metric.name: ChipsetStringHashValue
metric.summary: The first 8 bytes of SHA-256 of modalias of the bluetooth controller.

event.name: BluetoothA2dpAudioOverrun
event.summary: Records the A2DP overrun event.

metric.name: BootId
metric.summary: Random ID generated at boot time to detect reboots.

metric.name: SystemTime
metric.summary: The time elapsed since boot, in microseconds.

metric.name: DeviceId
metric.summary: The bluetooth device id.

metric.name: EncodingInterval
metric.summary: A2DP packet encoding interval in milliseconds.

metric.name: DroppedBuffers
metric.summary: Number of encoded buffers dropped from Tx queue.

metric.name: DroppedFrames
metric.summary: Number of encoded frames dropped from Tx queue.

metric.name: DroppedBytes
metric.summary: Number of encoded bytes dropped from Tx queue.

event.name: BluetoothA2dpSession
event.summary: Records the A2DP session metrics, filed when an A2DP session stops.

metric.name: BootId
metric.summary: Random ID generated at boot time to detect reboots.

metric.name: SystemTime
metric.summary: The time elapsed since boot, in microseconds.

metric.name: DeviceId
metric.summary: The bluetooth device id.

metric.name: AudioDuration
metric.summary: The duration of the A2DP session, in milliseconds.

metric.name: MediaTimerMin
metric.summary: Minimum time interval for the media timer, in milliseconds.

metric.name: MediaTimerMax
metric.summary: Maximum time interval for the media timer, in milliseconds.

metric.name: MediaTimerAvg
metric.summary: Average time interval for the media timer, in milliseconds.

metric.name: TotalSchedulingCount
metric.summary: Total scheduling count.

metric.name: BufferOverrunsMaxCount
metric.summary: Maximum count of Tx queue messages dropped caused by buffer overruns.

metric.name: BufferOverrunsTotal
metric.summary: Total count of Tx queue messages dropped caused by buffer overruns.

metric.name: BufferUnderrunsAvg
metric.summary: Average number of bytes short in buffer underruns.

metric.name: BufferUnderrunsCount
metric.summary: Count of buffer underruns.

metric.name: CodecIndex
metric.summary: A2DP codec index defined in bt_av.h (SBC=0, AAC=1, etc...).

metric.name: IsA2dpOffload
metric.summary: Boolean to denote if A2DP is offload.

event.name: BluetoothHfpPacketLoss
event.summary: Records the Hfp packet loss.

metric.name: BootId
metric.summary: Random ID generated at boot time to detect reboots.

metric.name: SystemTime
metric.summary: The time elapsed since boot, in microseconds.

metric.name: DeviceId
metric.summary: The bluetooth device id.

metric.name: DecodedFrames
metric.summary: The number of decoded frames.

metric.name: PacketLossRatio
metric.summary: The ratio of lost frames.

metric.name: CodecType
metric.summary: The codec ID such as mSBC(2), LC3(3).

event.name: BluetoothMmcTranscodeRtt
event.summary: Records statistics on the round-trip time for transcoding data using MMC.

metric.name: BootId
metric.summary: Random ID generated at boot time to detect reboots.

metric.name: SystemTime
metric.summary: The time elapsed since boot, in microseconds.

metric.name: MaximumRtt
metric.summary: Maximum rtt in microsecond.

metric.name: MeanRtt
metric.summary: Average rtt in microsecond.

metric.name: NumRequests
metric.summary: The number of transcoding requests in the session.

metric.name: CodecType
metric.summary: The codec type used in the session. The value corresponds to the field number described by |ConfigParam| in |mmc_config.proto|.

project.name: BluetoothDevice
project.summary: Project for recording Bluetooth device information separately from the main Bluetooth project to meet privacy constraints.

event.name: BluetoothDeviceInfo
event.summary: Records the bluetooth device info.

metric.name: DeviceType
metric.summary: The bluetooth device type such as LE, BREDR.

metric.name: DeviceClass
metric.summary: The major class of the BR/EDR device.

metric.name: DeviceCategory
metric.summary: The category of the BLE device.

metric.name: VendorId
metric.summary: The vendor id of the bluetooth device.

metric.name: VendorIdSource
metric.summary: The vendor id source such as SIG and USB.

metric.name: ProductId
metric.summary: The product id of the bluetooth device.

metric.name: ProductVersion
metric.summary: The product version of the bluetooth device.

project.name: BluetoothChipset
project.summary: Project for recording Bluetooth chipset information separately from the main Bluetooth project to meet privacy constraints.

event.name: BluetoothChipsetInfo
event.summary: Records the bluetooth chipset info.

metric.name: VendorId
metric.summary: The vendor id of the bluetooth controller.

metric.name: ProductId
metric.summary: The product id of the bluetooth controller.

metric.name: Transport
metric.summary: Which transport the bluetooth controller uses.

metric.name: ChipsetString
metric.summary: The modalias of the bluetooth controller.

project.name: CrashReporting
project.summary: Project for the crash reporting system to provide metrics on how well crash reporting is working and whether or not we are losing crashes.

event.name: CrashpadDetect
event.summary: Chrome's crashpad has detected a crash.

metric.name: Dummy
metric.summary: Dummy metric to work around b/326452906 (events must have at least one metric).

event.name: CrashReporterStart
event.summary: A crash reporter collector has started Collect()ing a crash. Usually recorded once per invocation, other than --init invocations; may be recorded twice for "crash reporter failure" results.

metric.name: Collector
metric.summary: Value from the CrashReporterCollector enum, indicating the collector that is running.

metric.name: CrashSendingMode
metric.summary: Value from CrashSendingMode, indicating if the crash was sent using crash-loop mode.

event.name: CrashReporterStatus
event.summary: A crash reporter collector has finished Collect()ing a crash, successfully or otherwise. Usually recorded once per invocation, other than --init invocations; may be recorded twice for "crash reporter failure" results.

metric.name: Status
metric.summary: Value from CrashCollectionStatus enum, indicating the final result of the collection attempt.

metric.name: Collector
metric.summary: Value from the CrashReporterCollector enum, indicating the collector that is running.

metric.name: CrashSendingMode
metric.summary: Value from CrashSendingMode, indicating if the crash was sent using crash-loop mode.

event.name: CrashReporterInitializationStart
event.summary: crash_reporter --init started. Recorded twice per boot (once early and once late).

metric.name: IsEarly
metric.summary: Boolean: 1 for early init, 0 for late init

event.name: CrashReporterInitializationStatus
event.summary: Result of crash_reporter --init. Recorded twice per boot (once early and once late).

metric.name: IsEarly
metric.summary: Boolean: 1 for early init, 0 for late init

metric.name: Status
metric.summary: Value from CrashReporterInitStatus enum, indicating the final result of the initialization attempt.

event.name: CrashSenderStart
event.summary: crash_sender has started processing a new crash file. Recorded once per crash send attempt. Not recorded in dry run mode.

metric.name: CrashSendingMode
metric.summary: Value from CrashSendingMode, indicating if crash sender was started using crash-loop mode.

event.name: CrashSenderStartPerCollector
event.summary: crash_sender has started processing a new crash file and has parsed the .meta file enough to know what collector the crash came from. Recorded once per crash send attempt, unless we can't parse the .meta file. Not recorded in dry run mode.

metric.name: Collector
metric.summary: Value from the CrashReporterCollector enum, indicating the collector that produced the .meta file.

metric.name: CrashSendingMode
metric.summary: Value from CrashSendingMode, indicating if crash sender was started using crash-loop mode.

event.name: CrashSenderRemovalReason
event.summary: If crash_sender removes a crash, records the reason it was removed. Recorded at most once per crash send attempt. Not recorded in dry run mode.

metric.name: Collector
metric.summary: Value from the CrashReporterCollector enum, indicating the collector that produced the .meta file. kUnknownCollector if we couldn't parse the .meta file.

metric.name: Reason
metric.summary: Value from CrashRemoveReason enum, indicating the reason crash_sender removed the crash record.

metric.name: CrashSendingMode
metric.summary: Value from CrashSendingMode, indicating if crash sender was started using crash-loop mode.

event.name: CrashSenderComplete
event.summary: crash_sender is finished with a crash send attempt, whether successfully or otherwise. Recorded once per crash send attempt. Not recorded in dry run mode.

metric.name: Collector
metric.summary: Value from the CrashReporterCollector enum, indicating the collector that produced the .meta file. kUnknownCollector if we couldn't parse the .meta file.

metric.name: Removed
metric.summary: Boolean: 1 if the crash record was removed, 0 if the crash record was left for the next time.

metric.name: CrashSendingMode
metric.summary: Value from CrashSendingMode, indicating if crash sender was started using crash-loop mode.

event.name: CrashSenderOrphanFileRemoved
event.summary: crash_sender found an old orphaned crash file (a file in the crash directory that does not correspond to a .meta file and is over 24 hours old) and attempted to remove it. Recorded once per orphan removal attempt.

metric.name: Removed
metric.summary: Boolean: 1 if the orphan file was successfully removed, 0 if the orphan file could not be removed.

metric.name: CrashSendingMode
metric.summary: Value from CrashSendingMode, indicating if crash sender was started using crash-loop mode.

metric.name: SeemingCrashFile
metric.summary: Boolean: 1 if the removed file matched crash_reporter's normal naming pattern (execname.date.time.random.pid.extention), 0 otherwise.

project.name: HardwareVerifier
project.summary: Project for hardware_verifier to record HardwareVerifier metrics. hardware_verifier is run once per boot.

event.name: HwVerificationReport
event.summary: Record a verification report once hardware_verifier runs. The event will be sent once per run.

metric.name: IsCompliant
metric.summary: The qualification status of components that are probed by hardware_verifier.

metric.name: QualificationStatusDisplayPanel
metric.summary: The qualification status of display_panel components.

metric.name: QualificationStatusStorage
metric.summary: The qualification status of storage components.

event.name: ComponentInfo
event.summary: Record a hardware component on devices probed by hardware_verifier. The event will be sent several times per run, depending on how many hardware components are probed. Since we only record display currently, there are usually 1~2 events. If we extend structured metrics to more hardware categories, e.g. battery, memory, storage, network, it would be about 10 events per run.

metric.name: ComponentCategory
metric.summary: The category of the recorded component.

metric.name: DisplayPanelVendor
metric.summary: The vendor of the display panel.

metric.name: DisplayPanelProductId
metric.summary: The product ID of the display panel.

metric.name: DisplayPanelHeight
metric.summary: The height of the display panel.

metric.name: DisplayPanelWidth
metric.summary: The width of the display panel.

metric.name: StorageMmcManfid
metric.summary: The manfid of the MMC storage.

metric.name: StorageMmcHwrev
metric.summary: The hwrev of the MMC storage.

metric.name: StorageMmcOemid
metric.summary: The oemid of the MMC storage.

metric.name: StorageMmcPrv
metric.summary: The prv of the MMC storage.

metric.name: StoragePciVendor
metric.summary: The vendor of the PCI (NVMe) storage.

metric.name: StoragePciDevice
metric.summary: The device ID of the PCI (NVMe) storage.

metric.name: StoragePciClass
metric.summary: The device class of the PCI (NVMe) storage.

project.name: Cellular
project.summary: Project for recording Cellular metrics.

event.name: CellularConnectionAttempt
event.summary: Records information of the last cellular connection attempt. An entry is logged immediately after the cellular connection fails or succeeds.

metric.name: apn_id
metric.summary: The ID of the APN used to establish the connection. This ID is a hash of the string uuid+apn_name+username+password.

metric.name: ipv4_config_method
metric.summary: The IPv4 config method(see IPConfig::Method) provided by the carrier.

metric.name: ipv6_config_method
metric.summary: The IPv6 config method(see IPConfig::Method) provided by the carrier.

metric.name: connect_result
metric.summary: The result of the connection. This uses the same values as the metric Network.Shill.Cellular.ConnectResult.

metric.name: home_mccmnc
metric.summary: The MCCMNC of the home provider.

metric.name: serving_mccmnc
metric.summary: The MCCMNC of the serving provider.

metric.name: roaming_state
metric.summary: Indicates if the device is roaming.

metric.name: apn_types
metric.summary: Indicates the APN types supported by the current APN. This field will represent the bitmask of combination of APN types. Below are the supported values: DEFAULT = 1 IA = 2 DUN = 4

metric.name: apn_source
metric.summary: Indicates the source of the APN. Options are: MODB == 0 , UI == 1, MODEM == 2, ADMIN == 4.

metric.name: tech_used
metric.summary:
Indicates the technologies in use for the connect attempt.
Value is a bitmask, allowing multiple simultaneous technologies, for instance for proper 5G-NSA reporting. Values are defined by the MMModemAccessTechnology enum in ModemManager[1].
[1] freedesktop.org/software/ModemManager/api/latest/ModemManager-Flags-and-Enumerations.html#MMModemAccessTechnology

metric.name: iccid_length
metric.summary: Indicates the length of ICCID used.

metric.name: sim_type
metric.summary: Indicates the type of SIM used. pSIM or eSIM. Options are Unknown == 0 , pSIM == 1 , eSIM == 2.

metric.name: modem_state
metric.summary: Indicates the modem state at the time of connection. Options are: Failed == -1 , Unknown == 0 , Initializing == 1 , Locked == 2 , Disabled == 3 , Disabling == 4 , Enabling == 5 , Enabled == 6 , Searching == 7 , Registered == 8 , Disconnecting == 9 , Connecting == 10 , Connected == 11.

metric.name: connect_time
metric.summary: Indicates the time in milliseconds, it took to connect to the cellular network.

metric.name: scan_connect_time
metric.summary: Indicates the time in milliseconds, it took to scan and connect to the cellular network.

metric.name: detailed_error
metric.summary: Indicates more granular and precise error, reported by modem manager, libmbim, libqmi etc.

metric.name: gid1
metric.summary: The contents of the GID1 file in the SIM card, limited to the first 8 bytes.

metric.name: use_apn_revamp_ui
metric.summary: Indicates if the new APN revamp UI is being used.

metric.name: connection_attempt_type
metric.summary: Indicates the way the connection attempt was triggered. Options are Unknown == 0 , UserConnect == 1 , AutoConnect == 2.

metric.name: subscription_error_seen
metric.summary: Indicates if modem has earlier reported subscription error for this card.

metric.name: connection_apn_types
metric.summary: Indicates the APN type used in the connection attempt, and the APN types of all other connected bearers. Each APN type is represented by a digit, and the order of the digits represents the connection order from first on the left, to last on the right. For example, a value of 23 indicates that a Default connection exists, and a new connection attempt is tried with a DUN APN. Below are the supported digit values: IA = 1 DEFAULT = 2 DUN = 3

metric.name: last_connected
metric.summary: Indicates the time in milliseconds, device last connected successfully to the cellular network.

metric.name: last_online
metric.summary: Indicates the time in milliseconds, device last connected successfully to the internet.

metric.name: modem_bus_type
metric.summary: Bus Type used to connect the modem. Options are UNKNOWN == 0, PCI == 1, USB == 2, SOC == 3.

metric.name: modem_vendor_id
metric.summary: The vendor id of the modem.

metric.name: modem_product_id
metric.summary: The Product id of the modem.

event.name: ModemFwdFwInstallResult
event.summary: Records information about the firmware installation operation performed by modemfwd. This includes details of firmware types which were installed by the modemfwd and information about the result of the firmware install operation. In case fimmware install operation fails and modem helpers are able to provide detailed error codes about reason of failure, they will also be included as part of this event.

metric.name: firmware_types
metric.summary: Indicates the set of firmware types modemfwd was trying to install. Modemfwd could install multiple types of firmware together based on the current status of the modem. This field will represent the bitmask of combination of firmware types being installed.Check ModemFirmwareType in modemfwd/metrics.h for possible firmware types.

metric.name: fw_install_result
metric.summary: Indicates the result of firmware install operation. Check FwInstallResult in modemfwd/metrics.h for list of possible values.

event.name: HermesOp
event.summary: Records information about eSIM operations

metric.name: Operation
metric.summary: Indicates the eSIM operation being performed.

metric.name: Result
metric.summary: Indicates the result of the eSIM operation. See hermes/lpa_util.cc for list of values.

metric.name: home_mccmnc
metric.summary: Indicates the mccmnc of the profile on which the eSIM operation was performed.

event.name: PowerOptimization
event.summary: The event is submit when a power optimization action is performed.

metric.name: power_state
metric.summary: Indicates the new modem power state.

metric.name: reason
metric.summary: Indicates the reason of setting the new power state.

metric.name: since_last_online_hours
metric.summary: Indicates hours passed since last online before this power optimization action.

event.name: CellularNetworkValidationAttempt
event.summary: Records information of the network validation attempt over cellular. An entry is logged immediately after portal detection fails or succeeds.

metric.name: apn_id
metric.summary: The ID of the APN used to establish the connection. This ID is a hash of the string uuid+apn_name+username+password.

metric.name: portal_detection_result
metric.summary: Result of the portal detection attempt(see Metrics::PortalDetectorResult).

metric.name: initial_result
metric.summary: Indicates if this is an initial portal attempt. Set to 1 for initial attempt else 0.

metric.name: ipv4_config_method
metric.summary: The IPv4 config method(see IPConfig::Method) provided by the carrier.

metric.name: ipv6_config_method
metric.summary: The IPv6 config method(see IPConfig::Method) provided by the carrier.

metric.name: home_mccmnc
metric.summary: The MCCMNC of the home provider.

metric.name: serving_mccmnc
metric.summary: The MCCMNC of the serving provider.

metric.name: roaming_state
metric.summary: Indicates if the device is roaming.

metric.name: tech_used
metric.summary:
Indicates the technologies in use for the connect attempt.
Value is a bitmask, allowing multiple simultaneous technologies, for instance for proper 5G-NSA reporting. Values are defined by the MMModemAccessTechnology enum in ModemManager[1].
[1] freedesktop.org/software/ModemManager/api/latest/ModemManager-Flags-and-Enumerations.html#MMModemAccessTechnology

metric.name: sim_type
metric.summary: Indicates the type of SIM used. pSIM or eSIM. Options are Unknown == 0 , pSIM == 1 , eSIM == 2.

project.name: GuestUsbDevice
project.summary: Project for recording info about USB devices that get attached to Crostini.

event.name: UsbDeviceInfo
event.summary: Records the USB device info when an attempt to connect it to Crostini is made.

metric.name: VendorId
metric.summary: The vendor id of the USB device.

metric.name: VendorName
metric.summary: The vendor name of the USB device.

metric.name: ProductId
metric.summary: The product id of the USB device.

metric.name: ProductName
metric.summary: The product name of the USB device.

metric.name: DeviceClass
metric.summary: The device class of the USB device.

metric.name: InterfaceClass
metric.summary: The list of interface classes of the USB device. It is highly unlikely that a single device has more than 20 interfaces, so max set to 20.

metric.name: CrostiniConnectionSuccess
metric.summary: Boolean to denote success of connecting device to Crostini.

metric.name: GuestType
metric.summary: Enum for which guest the USB device is being connected to. Value corresponds to system_api/dbus/vm_applications/apps.proto:VmType.

project.name: RollbackEnterprise
project.summary: Project for recording Enterprise Rollback metrics. Rollback involves a powerwash. To ensure the metrics are not lost, we track the events that happen before powerwash in a file and preserve it. Tracked events are reported after powerwash. It is possible that the date when the event is reported does not correspond to the date when the event happened.

event.name: RollbackPolicyActivated
event.summary: The administrator has set the policy to roll back to a previous version. This event happens before powerwash.

metric.name: origin_chromeos_version_major
metric.summary: ChromeOS major version of the device when the policy was set.

metric.name: origin_chromeos_version_minor
metric.summary: ChromeOS minor version of the device when the policy was set.

metric.name: origin_chromeos_version_patch
metric.summary: ChromeOS patch version of the device when the policy was set.

metric.name: target_chromeos_version_major
metric.summary: ChromeOS major target version selected in the policy.

metric.name: target_chromeos_version_minor
metric.summary: ChromeOS minor target version selected in the policy.

metric.name: target_chromeos_version_patch
metric.summary: ChromeOS patch target version selected by the policy.

event.name: RollbackOobeConfigSave
event.summary: Result of the process that encrypts and saves rollback data. This event happens before powerwash.

metric.name: origin_chromeos_version_major
metric.summary: ChromeOS major version of the device when the policy was set.

metric.name: origin_chromeos_version_minor
metric.summary: ChromeOS minor version of the device when the policy was set.

metric.name: origin_chromeos_version_patch
metric.summary: ChromeOS patch version of the device when the policy was set.

metric.name: target_chromeos_version_major
metric.summary: ChromeOS major target version selected in the policy.

metric.name: target_chromeos_version_minor
metric.summary: ChromeOS minor target version selected in the policy.

metric.name: target_chromeos_version_patch
metric.summary: ChromeOS patch target version selected by the policy.

metric.name: result
metric.summary: Result of running oobe_config_save: 0: Success. 1: Failure to save rollback data.

event.name: RollbackOobeConfigRestore
event.summary: Result of the process that decrypts and restores rollback data. This event happens after powerwash.

metric.name: origin_chromeos_version_major
metric.summary: ChromeOS major version of the device when the policy was set.

metric.name: origin_chromeos_version_minor
metric.summary: ChromeOS minor version of the device when the policy was set.

metric.name: origin_chromeos_version_patch
metric.summary: ChromeOS patch version of the device when the policy was set.

metric.name: target_chromeos_version_major
metric.summary: ChromeOS major target version selected in the policy.

metric.name: target_chromeos_version_minor
metric.summary: ChromeOS minor target version selected in the policy.

metric.name: target_chromeos_version_patch
metric.summary: ChromeOS patch target version selected by the policy.

metric.name: result_chromeos_version_major
metric.summary: ChromeOS major version of the device when reporting the event.

metric.name: result_chromeos_version_minor
metric.summary: ChromeOS minor version of the device when reporting the event.

metric.name: result_chromeos_version_patch
metric.summary: ChromeOS patch version of the device when reporting the event.

metric.name: result
metric.summary: Result of running oobe_config_restore: 0: Success. 1: Failure to decrypt rollback data. 2: Failure to read decrypted rollback data. 3: Failure to parse rollback data. 4: Failure to restore rollback data to config.

event.name: RollbackUpdateFailure
event.summary: Enterprise Rollback update failed. This event happens before powerwash. However, a powerwash is not imminent because of an error so the event should be reported immediately instead of being tracked in the file.

metric.name: origin_chromeos_version_major
metric.summary: ChromeOS major version of the device when the policy was set.

metric.name: origin_chromeos_version_minor
metric.summary: ChromeOS minor version of the device when the policy was set.

metric.name: origin_chromeos_version_patch
metric.summary: ChromeOS patch version of the device when the policy was set.

metric.name: target_chromeos_version_major
metric.summary: ChromeOS major target version selected in the policy.

metric.name: target_chromeos_version_minor
metric.summary: ChromeOS minor target version selected in the policy.

metric.name: target_chromeos_version_patch
metric.summary: ChromeOS patch target version selected by the policy.

event.name: RollbackCompleted
event.summary: Enterprise Rollback took place and the device is owned. This event happens after powerwash.

metric.name: origin_chromeos_version_major
metric.summary: ChromeOS major version of the device when the policy was set.

metric.name: origin_chromeos_version_minor
metric.summary: ChromeOS minor version of the device when the policy was set.

metric.name: origin_chromeos_version_patch
metric.summary: ChromeOS patch version of the device when the policy was set.

metric.name: target_chromeos_version_major
metric.summary: ChromeOS major target version selected in the policy.

metric.name: target_chromeos_version_minor
metric.summary: ChromeOS minor target version selected in the policy.

metric.name: target_chromeos_version_patch
metric.summary: ChromeOS patch target version selected by the policy.

metric.name: result_chromeos_version_major
metric.summary: ChromeOS major version of the device when reporting the event.

metric.name: result_chromeos_version_minor
metric.summary: ChromeOS minor version of the device when reporting the event.

metric.name: result_chromeos_version_patch
metric.summary: ChromeOS patch version of the device when reporting the event.

project.name: rmad
project.summary:
Project for rmad to record Shimless RMA metrics. The metrics of the whole RMA procedure are only recorded once after it is completed or aborted.
Note: this project skips the platform2-side UMA consent check for technical reasons, and relies on the chromium-side consent check instead.

event.name: ShimlessRmaReport
event.summary: Record a shimless rma report once it is completed or aborted.

metric.name: OverallTime
metric.summary: Overall time spent to complete the whole process in seconds.

metric.name: RunningTime
metric.summary: Time spent with RMA daemon running in seconds.

metric.name: IsComplete
metric.summary: Invocation of Shimless RMA: 1: RMA is complete, 0: RMA is aborted.

metric.name: RoVerificationStatus
metric.summary: RO verification of Shimless RMA: 0: Shimless RMA runs with unknown RO verification status. 1: Shimless RMA runs with RO verification successful. 2: Shimless RMA runs with RO verification unsupported. This should not happen because it's already deprecated. 3: RO verification is not triggered. This should not happen because Shimless RMA would not run. 4: RO verification fails. This should not happen because the DUT would not boot. 5: RO verification is unsupported and not triggered. This should not happen because Shimless RMA would not run. 6: Shimless RMA runs with RO verification unsupported but triggered.

metric.name: ReturningOwner
metric.summary: Destination of Shimless RMA: 0: Shimless RMA haven't known the returning owner yet 1: Shimless RMA run with the device returning to the same owner 2: Shimless RMA run with the device returning to a different owner

metric.name: MainboardReplacement
metric.summary: Replacement MLB of Shimless RMA: 0: Shimless RMA haven't known the mainboard replacement status 1: Shimless RMA run with a replaced MLB 2: Shimless RMA run with the original MLB

metric.name: WriteProtectDisableMethod
metric.summary: Write protection disable status of Shimless RMA: 0: Shimless RMA haven't known the write-protect status 1: Shimless RMA skip disabling write-protect 2: Shimless RMA run with write-protect being disabled via RSU 3: Shimless RMA run with write-protect being manually disabled with immediate re-enablement 4: Shimless RMA run with write-protect being manually disabled and keep the device open

event.name: ReplacedComponent
event.summary: Record a component replaced in Shimless RMA. The event will be sent several times per run, depending on how many components are replaced.

metric.name: ComponentCategory
metric.summary: The category of the recorded component. Enum for components defined in rmad.proto.

event.name: OccurredError
event.summary: Shimless RMA run with triggering of Error XYZ.

metric.name: ErrorType
metric.summary: The type of the recorded error. Enum for errors defined in rmad.proto.

event.name: AdditionalActivity
event.summary: Shimless RMA completed and an additional activity undertaken.

metric.name: ActivityType
metric.summary: 1: shutdown 2: reboot 3: battery cutoff 4: diagnostics

event.name: ShimlessRmaStateReport
event.summary: For each state. record a shimless rma state report once whole process is completed or aborted.

metric.name: StateCase
metric.summary: Please refer to the RmadState of rmad.proto for more info.

metric.name: IsAborted
metric.summary: 0: Abort is not called in the state. 1: Abort is called in the state.

metric.name: OverallTime
metric.summary: Overall time spent to complete the state in seconds.

metric.name: TransitionCount
metric.summary: How many transitions were taken in the state.

metric.name: GetLogCount
metric.summary: How many get log were taken in the state.

metric.name: SaveLogCount
metric.summary: How many save log were taken in the state.

project.name: UsbCameraModule
project.summary: Project for recording the most common camera modules in the field.

event.name: UsbCameraModuleInfo
event.summary: Records the information about the Internal USB Camera Module.

metric.name: VendorId
metric.summary: The vendor id of the USB Camera Module.

metric.name: VendorName
metric.summary: The vendor name of the USB Camera Module.

metric.name: ProductId
metric.summary: The product id of the USB Camera Module.

metric.name: ProductName
metric.summary: The product name of the USB Camera Module.

metric.name: BcdDevice
metric.summary: Firmware version of the device.

project.name: UsbDevice
project.summary: Project for recording basic USB device information that meets privacy constraints.

event.name: UsbDeviceInfo
event.summary: Records the USB device info.

metric.name: VendorId
metric.summary: The vendor id of the USB device.

metric.name: VendorName
metric.summary: The vendor name of the USB device.

metric.name: ProductId
metric.summary: The product id of the USB device.

metric.name: ProductName
metric.summary: The product name of the USB device.

metric.name: DeviceClass
metric.summary: The device class of the USB device.

metric.name: InterfaceClass
metric.summary: The list of interface classes of the USB device. It is highly unlikely that a single device has more than 20 interfaces, so max set to 20.

project.name: UsbSession
project.summary: Records events at various points of USB device connection for more detailed metrics on peripheral devices. These metrics are only recorded for devices in the USB metrics allowlist.

event.name: UsbSessionEvent
event.summary: Records events emitted by the kernel at notable points during a USB connection lifecycle.

metric.name: BootId
metric.summary: Random ID generated at boot time to detect reboots.

metric.name: SystemTime
metric.summary: The time elapsed since boot, in microseconds.

metric.name: Action
metric.summary: USB device action which caused the metric to be recorded (attach, remove, etc.).

metric.name: DeviceNum
metric.summary: USB device number assigned by the kernel to each connected USB device. Will be 0-127 and increment on every new device connection.

metric.name: BusNum
metric.summary: Bus number the USB device is connected on.

metric.name: Depth
metric.summary: Depth of device in the USB topology. This defines the number of hubs between a device and the host controller.

metric.name: VendorId
metric.summary: The vendor id of the USB device.

metric.name: ProductId
metric.summary: The product id of the USB device.

project.name: UsbQuality
project.summary: Project to measure USB device connectivity quality be recording USB data bus and power delivery quality indicators when devices are added or removed.

event.name: UsbBusConnect
event.summary: USB quality metric recorded on device enumeration.

metric.name: BootId
metric.summary: Random ID generated at boot time to detect reboots.

metric.name: Usb2ConnectionId
metric.summary: Unique device connection ID based on boot information, busnum and devnum for USB 2.0 devices.

metric.name: Usb3ConnectionId
metric.summary: Unique device connection ID based on boot information, busnum and devnum for USB 3.2 devices.

metric.name: VendorId
metric.summary: Vendor ID, obfuscated for unpopular devices.

metric.name: ProductId
metric.summary: Product ID, obfuscated for unpopular devices.

metric.name: LockScreen
metric.summary: Bool noting whether the lock screen is show. This impacts USBGuard behavior.

metric.name: Speed
metric.summary: USB device speed, based on UMA metric with fallback speeds.

metric.name: DeviceClass
metric.summary: The device's USB class.

metric.name: InterfaceClass
metric.summary: USB class for each of the device's interfaces.

metric.name: InterfaceSubClass
metric.summary: USB subclass for each of the device's interfaces.

metric.name: InterfaceProtocol
metric.summary: Protocol for each of the device's interfaces.

metric.name: InterfaceDriver
metric.summary: Drivers bound to each of the device's interfaces.

metric.name: Endpoint
metric.summary: List of endpoints used by the devices interfaces.

event.name: UsbBusDisconnect
event.summary: USB quality metric recorded on device disconnection.

metric.name: BootId
metric.summary: Random ID generated at boot time to detect reboots.

metric.name: Usb2ConnectionId
metric.summary: Unique device connection ID based on boot information, busnum and devnum for USB 2.0 devices.

metric.name: Usb3ConnectionId
metric.summary: Unique device connection ID based on boot information, busnum and devnum for USB 3.2 devices.

metric.name: VendorId
metric.summary: Vendor ID, obfuscated for unpopular devices.

metric.name: ProductId
metric.summary: Product ID, obfuscated for unpopular devices.

metric.name: DeviceError
metric.summary: List of USB errors in dmesg attributable to the device at when it is disconnected.

event.name: UsbPdConnect
event.summary: USB quality metric recorded on shortly after USB PD device registration.

metric.name: BootId
metric.summary: Random ID generated at boot time to detect reboots.

metric.name: Usb2ConnectionId
metric.summary: Unique device connection ID based on boot information, busnum and devnum if the USB PD device includes an internal USB 2.0 device.

metric.name: Usb3ConnectionId
metric.summary: Unique device connection ID based on boot information, busnum and devnum if the USB PD device includes an internal USB 3.2 device.

metric.name: VendorId
metric.summary: Vendor ID, obfuscated for unpopular devices.

metric.name: ProductId
metric.summary: Product ID, obfuscated for unpopular devices.

metric.name: PartnerType
metric.summary: Partner category derived from USB PD identity and mode support.

metric.name: CableType
metric.summary: Cable category derived from USB PD identity and mode support.

metric.name: MaxChargingRate
metric.summary: Wattage of highest available PDO.

metric.name: RealizedChargingRate
metric.summary: Wattage the port is sinking if applicable.

metric.name: ModeEntryResult
metric.summary: Enum specifying the attempted mode entered and a pass/fail result.

project.name: UsbError
project.summary: Project to record metrics on errors returned by notable kernel driver functions.

event.name: HubError
event.summary: Records error uevent sent by the Hub driver.

metric.name: ErrorCode
metric.summary: Linux kernel error code returned by function which sent the uevent.

metric.name: DeviceClass
metric.summary: The device class of the USB device which sent the uevent.

metric.name: VendorId
metric.summary: The vendor ID of the USB device which sent the uevent. This is filtered through an allow list to only record vendor ID for popular devices.

metric.name: ProductId
metric.summary: The product ID of the USB device which sent the uevent. This is filtered through an allow list to only record product ID for popular devices.

metric.name: DevicePath
metric.summary: The device path of the usb device which sent the uevent, this value is taken from the devpath file in the device's sysfs directory.

metric.name: ConnectedDuration
metric.summary: Time, in milliseconds, that the USB device has been connected.

event.name: XhciError
event.summary: Records error uevent sent by the xHCI driver.

metric.name: ErrorCode
metric.summary: Linux kernel error code returned by function which sent the uevent.

metric.name: DeviceClass
metric.summary: The device class of the kernel device which sent the error uevent.

project.name: UsbPdDevice
project.summary: Project for recording basic USB PD device information that meets privacy constraints.

event.name: UsbPdDeviceInfo
event.summary: Records the USB PD device info.

metric.name: VendorId
metric.summary: The vendor id of the USB PD device.

metric.name: ProductId
metric.summary: The product id of the USB PD device.

metric.name: ExitId
metric.summary: XID of the USB PD device that is uniquely assigned by USB-IF once it is certified. Set to 0 if the device is not certified.

metric.name: SupportsPd
metric.summary: Boolean to indicate if the device supports USB PD.

metric.name: SupportsUsb
metric.summary: Boolean to indicate if the device supports USB.

metric.name: SupportsDp
metric.summary: Boolean to indicate if the device supports DP alt mode.

metric.name: SupportsTbt
metric.summary: Boolean to indicate if the device supports TBT alt mode.

metric.name: SupportsUsb4
metric.summary: Boolean to indicate if the device supports USB4 mode.

metric.name: DataRole
metric.summary: Enum for data role. 0: None, 1: Device, 2: Host.

metric.name: PowerRole
metric.summary: Enum for power role. 0: None, 1: Sink, 2: Source.

metric.name: PartnerType
metric.summary: Partner category derived from USB PD identity and mode support.

project.name: WiFiChipset
project.summary: Information about the WiFi adapter present on the system. Different project from the main "WiFi" project to meet privacy requirements.

event.name: WiFiChipsetInfo
event.summary: Records which chipset is installed on the system.

metric.name: EventVersion
metric.summary: Integer version number that indicates the format of the event. Used by the event processor to know which metric is available in a particular event. v0: unknown (should not happen) v1: initial version

metric.name: VendorId
metric.summary: Manufacturer ID of the WiFi adapter.

metric.name: ProductId
metric.summary: Product ID of the WiFi adapter.

metric.name: SubsystemId
metric.summary: Subsystem ID of the WiFi adapter.

project.name: WiFiAP
project.summary: Information (e.g. OUI) about the AP we're connected to. Different project from the main "WiFi" project to meet privacy requirements.

event.name: WiFiAPInfo
event.summary: Records information about the AP the device is attempting to connect to.

metric.name: EventVersion
metric.summary: Integer version number that indicates the format of the event. Used by the event processor to know which metric is available in a particular event. v0: unknown (should not happen) v1: initial version

metric.name: APOUI
metric.summary: OUI of the AP we're connecting to.

project.name: WiFi
project.summary: WiFi health metrics.

event.name: WiFiAdapterStateChanged
event.summary: Records when the adapter is enabled/disabled.

metric.name: BootId
metric.summary: Random ID generated at boot time to detect reboots.

metric.name: SystemTime
metric.summary: The time elapsed since boot, in microseconds.

metric.name: EventVersion
metric.summary: Integer version number that indicates the format of the event. Used by the event processor to know which metric is available in a particular event. v0: unknown (should not happen) v1: initial version

metric.name: AdapterState
metric.summary: The state of the WiFi adapter, 0 for disabled and 1 for enabled.

metric.name: VendorId
metric.summary: Manufacturer ID of the WiFi adapter.

metric.name: ProductId
metric.summary: Product ID of the WiFi adapter.

metric.name: SubsystemId
metric.summary: Subsystem ID of the WiFi adapter.

event.name: WiFiConnectionAttempt
event.summary: Device starts to try to connect to a particular AP.

metric.name: BootId
metric.summary: Random ID generated at boot time to detect reboots.

metric.name: SystemTime
metric.summary: The time elapsed since boot, in microseconds.

metric.name: EventVersion
metric.summary: Integer version number that indicates the format of the event. Used by the event processor to know which metric is available in a particular event. v0: unknown (should not happen) v1: initial version

metric.name: SessionTag
metric.summary: A SessionTag links a WiFiConnectionAttempt, WiFiConnectionAttemptResult and WiFiConnectionEnd that correspond to the same connection.

metric.name: AttemptType
metric.summary: Type of connection attempt (e.g. autoconnect, manual connect, ...)

metric.name: APPhyMode
metric.summary: Enum |WiFiNetworkPhyMode| reporting if we are connecting to 802.11n, 802.11ac, 802.11ax, etc.

metric.name: APSecurityMode
metric.summary: Enum |WiFiSecurity| reporting the security mode: Open? WEP? WPA? 802.1X?

metric.name: APSecurityEAPInnerProtocol
metric.summary: Enum |EapInnerProtocol| reporting the EAP inner protocol for 802.1X.

metric.name: APSecurityEAPOuterProtocol
metric.summary: Enum |EapOuterProtocol| reporting the EAP outer protocol for 802.1X.

metric.name: APBand
metric.summary: Enum |WiFiFrequencyRange| reporting the band we're connecting to: 2.4GHz, 5GHz, 6GHz.

metric.name: APChannel
metric.summary: Enum |WiFiChannel| describing the frequency of the channel we're connecting on.

metric.name: RSSI
metric.summary: RSSI of the AP we're trying to connect to.

metric.name: SSID
metric.summary: Pseudonymized SSID that we're connecting to.

metric.name: SSIDProvisioningMode
metric.summary: Enum describing how the SSID was provisioned. Was it configured through policy? Was it manually added? Was it synced?

metric.name: SSIDHidden
metric.summary: Set to 1 if we're connecting to a hidden SSID, 0 otherwise.

metric.name: BSSID
metric.summary: Pseudonymized BSSID that we're connecting to.

metric.name: APOUI
metric.summary: OUI of the AP. The 24 least significant bits contain the OUI.

metric.name: AP_80211krv_NLSSupport
metric.summary: Boolean indicating if the AP supports 802.11k/r/v neighbour lists or not. Set to -1 if detection failed.

metric.name: AP_80211krv_OTA_FTSupport
metric.summary: Boolean indicating if the AP supports 802.11k/r/v Fast Transition Over The Air or not. Set to -1 if detection failed.

metric.name: AP_80211krv_OTDS_FTSupport
metric.summary: Boolean indicating if the AP supports 802.11k/r/v Fast Transition Over The DS or not. Set to -1 if detection failed.

metric.name: AP_80211krv_DMSSupport
metric.summary: Boolean indicating if the AP supports 802.11k/r/v DMS or not. Set to -1 if detection failed.

metric.name: AP_80211krv_BSSMaxIdleSupport
metric.summary: Boolean indicating if the AP supports 802.11k/r/v BSS Max Idle period feature or not. Set to -1 if detection failed.

metric.name: AP_80211krv_BSSTMSupport
metric.summary: Boolean indicating if the AP supports 802.11k/r/v BSS Transition Management or not. Set to -1 if detection failed.

metric.name: AP_HS20Support
metric.summary: Boolean indicating if the AP supports Hotspot 2.0 (aka Passpoint) or not. Set to -1 if detection failed.

metric.name: AP_HS20Version
metric.summary: Version of the Hotspot 2.0 (aka Passpoint) support. Set to -1 if detection failed.

metric.name: AP_MBOSupport
metric.summary: Boolean indicating if the AP supports MBO or not. Set to -1 if detection failed.

event.name: WiFiConnectionAttemptResult
event.summary: Report if the connection attempt succeeded or not and the reason if not.

metric.name: BootId
metric.summary: Random ID generated at boot time to detect reboots.

metric.name: SystemTime
metric.summary: The time elapsed since boot, in microseconds.

metric.name: EventVersion
metric.summary: Integer version number that indicates the format of the event. Used by the event processor to know which metric is available in a particular event. v0: unknown (should not happen) v1: initial version

metric.name: SessionTag
metric.summary: A SessionTag links a WiFiConnectionAttempt, WiFiConnectionAttemptResult and WiFiConnectionEnd that correspond to the same connection.

metric.name: ResultCode
metric.summary: Enum |NetworkServiceError| reporting the status of the connection attempt. Reports the error code (e.g. "too-many-stas") if the connection attempt failed. Reports 0 (NetworkServiceError::kNetworkServiceErrorNone) if the connection attempt succeeded.

event.name: WiFiIPConnectivityStatus
event.summary: WiFi link is up, report if the device is fully IP provisioned or if there are still IP connectivity failures (e.g. failed to get an IP address).

metric.name: BootId
metric.summary: Random ID generated at boot time to detect reboots.

metric.name: SystemTime
metric.summary: The time elapsed since boot, in microseconds.

metric.name: EventVersion
metric.summary: Integer version number that indicates the format of the event. Used by the event processor to know which metric is available in a particular event. v0: unknown (should not happen) v1: initial version

metric.name: IPConnectivityStatus
metric.summary: Enum reporting the connectivity status (Connection OK, DHCP issues, ...)

metric.name: IPConnectivityType
metric.summary: Enum |NetworkConnectionIPType| reporting the type of connectivity (IPv4 or IPv6).

event.name: WiFiPortalDetectionStatus
event.summary: IP connectivity is up, report the state of captive portal detection.

metric.name: BootId
metric.summary: Random ID generated at boot time to detect reboots.

metric.name: SystemTime
metric.summary: The time elapsed since boot, in microseconds.

metric.name: EventVersion
metric.summary: Integer version number that indicates the format of the event. Used by the event processor to know which metric is available in a particular event. v0: unknown (should not happen) v1: initial version

metric.name: PortalDetectionStatus
metric.summary: Enum |PortalResult| reporting the status of the detection of the captive portal.

event.name: WiFiConnectionEnd
event.summary: Report when the device disconnects or is disconnected from the AP.

metric.name: BootId
metric.summary: Random ID generated at boot time to detect reboots.

metric.name: SystemTime
metric.summary: The time elapsed since boot, in microseconds.

metric.name: EventVersion
metric.summary: Integer version number that indicates the format of the event. Used by the event processor to know which metric is available in a particular event. v0: unknown (should not happen) v1: initial version

metric.name: SessionTag
metric.summary: A SessionTag links a WiFiConnectionAttempt, WiFiConnectionAttemptResult and WiFiConnectionEnd that correspond to the same connection.

metric.name: DisconnectionType
metric.summary: Log what type of disconnection happened: - expected because of suspend or poweroff - expected because of roaming - unexpected because the AP disconnected the device - unexpected because the device no longer hears the AP - etc

metric.name: DisconnectionReasonCode
metric.summary: Enum |WiFiReasonCode| to report the reason there was an unexpected disconnection.

event.name: WiFiLinkQualityTrigger
event.summary: Report when shill or wpa_supplicant requests a Link Quality Report from the firmware/driver. It can happen when the kernel has notified userspace that the wireless link may be having issues (e.g. low RSSI, beacon or packet loss, IP-level failures...) or when userspace simply wants to monitor the quality of the link periodically.

metric.name: BootId
metric.summary: Random ID generated at boot time to detect reboots.

metric.name: SystemTime
metric.summary: The time elapsed since boot, in microseconds.

metric.name: EventVersion
metric.summary: Integer version number that indicates the format of the event. Used by the event processor to know which metric is available in a particular event. v0: unknown (should not happen) v1: initial version

metric.name: SessionTag
metric.summary: A SessionTag links a WiFiConnectionAttempt, WiFiConnectionAttemptResult and WiFiConnectionEnd that correspond to the same connection.

metric.name: Type
metric.summary: Enum |WiFiLinkQualityTrigger| to report what type of event triggered a Link Quality Report: - CQM event - IP level failure - Periodic polling - ...

event.name: WiFiLinkQualityReport
event.summary: Report statistics about the WiFi link (e.g. bitrate, TX retransmit rates) that can be used to diagnose if the wireless link is good or bad. Most metrics are defined in nl80211_sta_info and nl80211_rate_info, or derived from some of those attributes.

metric.name: BootId
metric.summary: Random ID generated at boot time to detect reboots.

metric.name: SystemTime
metric.summary: The time elapsed since boot, in microseconds.

metric.name: EventVersion
metric.summary: Integer version number that indicates the format of the event. Used by the event processor to know which metric is available in a particular event. v0: unknown (should not happen) v1: initial version

metric.name: SessionTag
metric.summary: A SessionTag links a WiFiConnectionAttempt, WiFiConnectionAttemptResult and WiFiConnectionEnd that correspond to the same connection.

metric.name: RXPackets
metric.summary: Number of packets received (NL80211_STA_INFO_RX_PACKETS).

metric.name: RXBytes
metric.summary: Number of bytes received (NL80211_STA_INFO_RX_BYTES).

metric.name: TXPackets
metric.summary: Number of packets transmitted (NL80211_STA_INFO_TX_PACKETS).

metric.name: TXBytes
metric.summary: Number of bytes transmitted (NL80211_STA_INFO_TX_BYTES).

metric.name: TXRetries
metric.summary: Number of TX retransmissions (NL80211_STA_INFO_TX_RETRIES).

metric.name: TXFailures
metric.summary: Number of TX failures (NL80211_STA_INFO_TX_FAILED).

metric.name: RXDrops
metric.summary: Number of RX packets dropped (NL80211_STA_INFO_RX_DROP_MISC).

metric.name: Chain0Signal
metric.summary: Signal strength of chain 0 (NL80211_STA_INFO_CHAIN_SIGNAL).

metric.name: Chain0SignalAvg
metric.summary: Average signal strength (NL80211_STA_INFO_CHAIN_SIGNAL_AVG).

metric.name: Chain1Signal
metric.summary: Signal strength of chain 1 (NL80211_STA_INFO_CHAIN_SIGNAL).

metric.name: Chain1SignalAvg
metric.summary: Average signal strength (NL80211_STA_INFO_CHAIN_SIGNAL_AVG).

metric.name: BeaconSignalAvg
metric.summary: Average signal strength of beacons (NL80211_STA_INFO_BEACON_SIGNAL_AVG).

metric.name: BeaconsReceived
metric.summary: Number of beacons received (NL80211_STA_INFO_BEACON_RX).

metric.name: BeaconsLost
metric.summary: Number of beacons lost (NL80211_STA_INFO_BEACON_LOSS).

metric.name: ExpectedThroughput
metric.summary: Expected throughput (NL80211_STA_EXPECTED_THROUGHPUT).

metric.name: RXRate
metric.summary: RX bitrate in 100Kb/s units (NL80211_RATE_INFO_BITRATE32).

metric.name: RXMCS
metric.summary: RX MCS index. nl80211: NL80211_RATE_INFO_MCS, NL80211_RATE_INFO_VHT_MCS, NL80211_RATE_INFO_HE_MCS, NL80211_RATE_INFO_EHT_MCS

metric.name: RXChannelWidth
metric.summary: Bandwidth of the channel (20MHz, 40MHz, etc.) nl80211: NL80211_ATTR_CHANNEL_WIDTH shill: WiFiChannelWidth enum

metric.name: RXMode
metric.summary: Is the link in HT, VHT, HE, EHT mode? nl80211: NL80211_RATE_INFO_VHT_*, NL80211_RATE_INFO_HE_*, NL80211_RATE_INFO_EHT_* shill: WiFiLinkStatsMode enum

metric.name: RXGuardInterval
metric.summary: Is the guard interval 400ns, 800ns, 1.6us or 3.2 us? nl80211: NL80211_RATE_INFO_SHORT_GI, NL80211_RATE_INFO_HE_GI shill: WiFiLinkStatsGI enum

metric.name: RXNSS
metric.summary: RX NSS, number of spatial streams. nl80211: NL80211_RATE_INFO_VHT_NSS, NL80211_RATE_INFO_HE_NSS

metric.name: RXDCM
metric.summary: RX HE DCM, dual carrier modulation (NL80211_RATE_INFO_HE_DCM).

metric.name: TXRate
metric.summary: TX bitrate in 100Kb/s units (NL80211_RATE_INFO_BITRATE32).

metric.name: TXMCS
metric.summary: TX MCS index. nl80211: NL80211_RATE_INFO_MCS, NL80211_RATE_INFO_VHT_MCS, NL80211_RATE_INFO_HE_MCS, NL80211_RATE_INFO_EHT_MCS

metric.name: TXChannelWidth
metric.summary: Bandwidth of the channel (20MHz, 40MHz, etc.). Identical to RXChannelWidth, kept for compatibility reasons. nl80211: NL80211_ATTR_CHANNEL_WIDTH shill: WiFiChannelWidth enum TODO(b/261499918): when we uprev EventVersion, only keep one of the redundant fields.

metric.name: TXMode
metric.summary: Is the link in HT, VHT, HE, EHT mode? nl80211: NL80211_RATE_INFO_VHT_*, NL80211_RATE_INFO_HE_*, NL80211_RATE_INFO_EHT_* shill: WiFiLinkStatsMode enum

metric.name: TXGuardInterval
metric.summary: Is the guard interval 400ns, 800ns, 1.6us or 3.2 us? nl80211: NL80211_RATE_INFO_SHORT_GI, NL80211_RATE_INFO_HE_GI shill: WiFiLinkStatsGI enum

metric.name: TXNSS
metric.summary: TX NSS, number of spatial streams. nl80211: NL80211_RATE_INFO_VHT_NSS, NL80211_RATE_INFO_HE_NSS

metric.name: TXDCM
metric.summary: TX HE DCM, dual carrier modulation (NL80211_RATE_INFO_HE_DCM).

metric.name: BTEnabled
metric.summary: Boolean. Is Bluetooth enabled?

metric.name: BTStack
metric.summary: Enum describing which BT stack (BlueZ, Floss, ...) is in use. shill: Metrics::BTStack enum

metric.name: BTHFP
metric.summary: Boolean. Is Bluetooth performing HFP?

metric.name: BTA2DP
metric.summary: Boolean. Is Bluetooth performing A2DP?

metric.name: BTActivelyScanning
metric.summary: Boolean. Is Bluetooth scanning actively?

metric.name: FCSErrors
metric.summary: FCS Errors (NL80211_STA_INFO_FCS_ERROR_COUNT).

metric.name: RXMPDUS
metric.summary: RX MPDUS (NL80211_STA_INFO_RX_MPDUS).

metric.name: InactiveTime
metric.summary: Inactive time (NL80211_STA_INFO_INACTIVE_TIME).

metric.name: Noise
metric.summary: Noise level of channel (NL80211_SURVEY_INFO_NOISE).

metric.name: AckSignalAverage
metric.summary: Ack Signal Average (NL80211_STA_INFO_ACK_SIGNAL_AVG).

metric.name: LastAckSignal
metric.summary: Last Ack Signal (NL80211_STA_INFO_ACK_SIGNAL).

metric.name: Signal
metric.summary: Signal (NL80211_STA_INFO_SIGNAL).

metric.name: SignalAverage
metric.summary: Signal Average (NL80211_STA_INFO_SIGNAL_AVG).

project.name: AudioPeripheralInfo
project.summary: Project for audio peripheral popularity study. This is to get the list of top audio peripherals.

event.name: Info
event.summary: Emit before trying to use the device.

metric.name: Type
metric.summary: enum CRAS_NODE_TYPE.

metric.name: VendorId
metric.summary: The vendor id of the device.

metric.name: ProductId
metric.summary: The product id of the device.

project.name: AudioPeripheral
project.summary: Project for top audio peripherals running time and audio settings study.

event.name: Close
event.summary: Emit when close the device.

metric.name: Type
metric.summary: enum CRAS_NODE_TYPE.

metric.name: VendorId
metric.summary: The vendor id of the USB device.

metric.name: ProductId
metric.summary: The product id of the USB device.

metric.name: DeviceRuntime
metric.summary: The runtime is the duration between opening and closing a device. The value is recorded when the device is closed.

metric.name: SamplingRate
metric.summary: The sampling rate to open the device.

metric.name: Channel
metric.summary: The channel count to open the device.

metric.name: PCMFormat
metric.summary: The snd_pcm_format_t to open the device.
